episodes.summary: The authors of two buzzy new novels, Homegoing and Welcome to Lagos, explore ancient and modern stories of west Africa

episodes.title: Michael Chabon on The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier and Clay – books podcast

episodes.summary: The Pulitzer prize-winning novelist looks back on a modern classic at a Guardian book club event

episodes.title: Sebastian Barry on his Costa-winning novel Days Without End – books podcast

episodes.summary: We chart the business of making books from manuscript to bookshop shelf and beyond

episodes.summary: As 21st-century telescopes transform the hunt for extraterrestrials from SF to hard science, physicist Jim Al-Khalili examines the prospects for finding life in space

episodes.summary: A national treasure reads from the latest volume of his diaries and discusses finding inspiration in the everyday

episodes.title: The Last Poets – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Famed for militant spoken-word poetry about black America from the height of the civil rights struggle, the Last Poets join us to perform and talk about their own battles

episodes.title: Books of the year, with Sarah Perry and Francis Spufford - podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Costa contenders The Essex Serpent and Golden Hill bring historical fiction to the fore as we predict the books that will last from 2016

episodes.title: Deadly beauty with Ruth Padel and Lucinda Hawksley – books podcast

episodes.summary: Poetry and poison combine as we look at a lavishly illustrated history of arsenic in the home and a book-length Christmas poem

episodes.title: Nadja Spiegelman and Alex Wheatle - books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com

episodes.title: Margaret Drabble and the Ruby Dolls - books podcast

episodes.summary: The challenges of ageing and the dark side of fairy stories examined in a novel, The Dark Flood Rises, and the cabaret Brides of Bluebeard

episodes.title: Alan Moore talks to Stewart Lee – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: The comics legend tells the standup comic why his latest project is a small-town novel set in the Midlands, running to 1,280 pages and titled Jerusalem

episodes.summary: We investigate crime fiction from the frozen north with two of Finland’s rising literary stars

episodes.title: Climate change with Amitav Ghosh and Aaron Thier – books podcast

episodes.summary: Amitav Ghosh discusses the failure of literary culture to confront climate change, while Aaron Thier explains how his novel Mr Eternity reflects current fears

episodes.title: Jonathan Safran Foer on his novel Here I Am – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: The American writer discusses his first novel in 11 years, books he hasn’t finished – and how his fiction is driven by instinct

episodes.title: Goldsmiths prize and Anakana Schofield – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Blake Morrison discusses the UK’s most radical literary prize, while Anakana Schofield talks about the novel that earned her a place on the Goldsmiths shortlist

episodes.title: Susan Hill on ghost stories – books podcast

episodes.summary: Susan Hill discusses the timeless appeal of the ghost story and reads from her new collection, while the Bookshop Band get into the Halloween spirit

episodes.title: Booker finalist Paul Beatty and Super Thursday – books podcast

episodes.title: Colin Thubron and John Aggleton on memory – books podcast

episodes.summary: How can we construct a sense of self from the fragments of life we can recall? We dissect how science and fiction shed light on the mysteries of memory

episodes.summary: Warning strong language and imagery described in this podcast: This week’s podcast is dedicated to an in-depth and thorny discussion of women in sci-fi and the process of writing in and around the genre.

episodes.title: Don DeLillo on writing his novel Underworld - books podcast

episodes.summary: The American novelist Don DeLillo gives an account of writing his modern masterpiece Underworld to the Guardian book club

episodes.title: Simon Ingram and Fiona Reynolds on our natural landscapes – books podcast

episodes.summary: Simon Ingram tackles the forbidding rock face of the mountaineering memoir, while Fiona Reynolds mounts a passionate plea for the defence of our natural landscape

episodes.title: Maggie Nelson and Chris Kraus on confessional writing – books podcast

episodes.title: Han Kang, winner of the Man Booker International 2016 - podcast interview

episodes.summary: The South Korean author of The Vegetarian explains her mysterious fable of a woman who refuses to eat Han Kang wins the 2016 Man Booker International prize

episodes.title: Book festivals around the world – books podcast

episodes.summary: We drop in on Lahore, track Jean Rhys back to the Caribbean and tackle the troubling issue of payments to authors appearing at the UK’s 350 literary jamborees

episodes.title: Writing crime with Donna Leon, Duncan Campbell and Barry Forshaw – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Crime writing is up for interrogation this week, as we examine the evidence for our abiding obsession with murder and misdemeanours in both fact and fiction

episodes.title: Sara Pascoe and Amy Stewart on the female body – books podcast

episodes.summary: Comedian Sara Pascoe explores how our experience is shaped by our physical form in Animal, and we track down a New Jersey pioneer with Amy Stewart

episodes.title: Hearing voices with Charles Fernyhough and Francesca Kay – books podcast

episodes.summary: We tune in to the voices inside our heads with the psychologist Charles Fernyhough and the novelist Francesca Kay

episodes.title: Reading the globe at the London book fair – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: We head to the UK’s biggest book fair to find independent publishers bringing us literary gems from all over the world

episodes.title: Russian poetry and poison with Luke Harding and Pussy Riot - books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Guardian journalist Luke Harding and filmmaker Peter Pomerantsev discuss the assassination of Aleksander Litvinenko, and Masha Aloykhina of Pussy Riot shares the poetry that helped her survive prison

episodes.title: Rewriting the Qur'an and rereading Hanya Yanagihara – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: We look at challenging writing from both sides, with Iranian author Kader Abdolah and a discussion about the difficult experience of reading Hanya Yanagihara’s novel A Little Life

episodes.summary: We put politics, performance and poetry under the lens with spoken-word stars Luke Wright and Hollie McNish

episodes.title: Writing about art, music and loneliness – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Robin Ince and Green Gartside explain why the music world needs a book prize and Olivia Laing follows Edward Hopper and Andy Warhol down lonely street

episodes.title: Imagining the future with Claire Vaye Watkins and Leif Wenar – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: We look ahead to a dystopian California and a world where the wealth brought by oil no longer fuels autocrats and extremists

episodes.title: Karl Ove Knausgaard, in conversation with John Mullan – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com

episodes.title: Medical literature with Chris Brookmyre, Gavin Francis and Samer Nashef – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: We travel around the human body with GP Gavin Francis, venture into the operating theatre with surgeon Samer Nashef and join investigative reporter Jack Parlabane on the trail of ‘blade bitch’

episodes.title: Reading Infinite Jest 20 years on – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Twenty years after David Foster Wallace’s magnum opus was first published it continues to delight and astonish. We discuss the unending pleasures of Infinite Jest

episodes.title: Guardian Books Podcast: a special from the Calais Jungle
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: On a trip to the Calais refugee camp known as ‘the Jungle’, we explore the impact of books, storytelling and creativity on the refugees there, take a tour of their library and speak to one of the members of Pussy Riot visiting the camp

episodes.title: Welcome to Britain with Ben Judah and Sunjeev Sahota – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: As migration continues to dominate the headlines, we go walkabout in a capital city transformed by new arrivals with Ben Judah, while Sunjeev Sahota explores home and identity in Sheffield

episodes.title: John Irving in conversation with Jeanette Winterson - Guardian Live
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: At a Guardian Live event John Irving, one of America’s greatest living novelists, discusses his new book, Avenue of Mysteries, with author and professor of creative writing Jeanette Winterson

episodes.title: Celebrating libraries with Ali Smith, Jackie Kay and Tom Holland – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: As National Libraries Day approaches, we salute these temples of learning with the writers Ali Smith, Jackie Kay and Tom Holland, and head across the Channel to find out what’s on the shelves of the library in Calais’ Jungle

episodes.title: What makes a book great? with Frances Hardinge and Robert McCrum – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: As a children’s novel is proclaimed Costa book of the year, and a new Guardian series sets out to identify the 100 best non-fiction books of all time, we investigate literary stature

episodes.title: Frederick Forsyth with Mark Lawson - Guardian Live event
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: To celebrate the publication of his autobiography The Outsider, Frederick Forsyth gives a rare public interview discussing his life as a bestselling novelist and Cold War spy

episodes.title: The great outdoors with Amy Liptrot and Emily Chappell – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: This week we find ourselves out of doors on the windswept islands of Orkney with Amy Liptrot and among the traffic-clogged streets of London with Emily Chappell

episodes.title: Poetry, music and identity with Sarah Howe, Emmy the Great and Solomon OB – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: The winners of the TS Eliot prize and the National poetry slam explore the territory between lyric and music with singer-songwriter Emmy the Great

episodes.title: Bill Bryson on Notes from a Small Island – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: As Bill Bryson returns to travel writing after 15 years with The Road to Little Dribbling, he joins John Mullan to discuss his voyages around the United Kingdom

episodes.title: EL James: black and blue and read all over? – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: John Crace whips through the lastest instalment of EL James’s sado-masochistic bestseller, Grey, and asks if it’s time to apply the safe word

episodes.title: Michel Houellebecq:  profane or prophetic? – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: John Crace squashes Houellebecq’s Submission and asks whether the sacred monster of French fiction is just making trouble for its own sake

episodes.title: TS Eliot: beyond commentary? – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: John Crace puts the annotated editon of the Nobel laureate’s poetical works through the wringer and assesses the stature of the modernist master

episodes.title: Kazuo Ishiguro: roaring giant or sleeping dragon?  – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: John Crace boils down The Buried Giant and asks whether this genre-bending quest novel is destined for the halls of glory or the mists of forgetfulness

episodes.title: Harper Lee: a happy return to Maycomb? – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: John Crace puts the squeeze on Go Set a Watchman, and considers its effect on the author’s reputation

episodes.title: An evening with Marlon James - books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Gangs, gay sex and pandering to the white woman. Man Booker prize winner Marlon James talks to Guardian books editor, Claire Armitstead, and answers audience questions at a Guardian Live event on A Brief History of Seven Killings

episodes.title: 2015 in books – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Harper Lee stuns the world, Marlon James puts Jamaica on the Booker map and Michel Houellebecq imagines a Muslim France – our critics wrap up the year

episodes.title: Guardian children's books podcast with Owen Jones: 'there's a craving for an alternative to how things are run'
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Political commentator Owen Jones is grilled by teen site members CaraErica, Patrick and TheBookAddictedGirl on the writers who inspired his democratic socialist politics, the advice he’d give his 16-year-old self, and how young people should get involved in politics – and why… The Establishment is our current Teen book club read – find out what else is happening here

episodes.title: Philip Hensher on the great British short story – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Famous authors from Arthur Conan Doyle to Zadie Smith mingle with unfamiliar talents in an anthology which – according to its editor – proves the glory of an unjustly neglected artform with a 300-year pedigree

episodes.title: Jonathan Franzen on Freedom - books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: The award-winning author explains to the Guardian book club why he felt compelled to give babyboomers such a hard time in his acclaimed 2010 novel Find out more about Guardian Live events

episodes.title: Guardian first book award winner Andrew McMillan – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: We join judges, readers, the editor Robin Robertson and the winner of the 2015 Guardian first book award, Andrew McMillan

episodes.title: Exploring identity with Kevin Barry and Vendela Vida – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: We examine the attractions of stepping into someone else's shoes with the novelists Kevin Barry and Vendela Vida

episodes.title: Guardian children's books podcast with Sandi Toksvig: 'children disappear in history'
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Sandi Toksvig reads from and talks about her latest book, A Slice of the Moon, an action-packed story of one family's journey across the world as they leave behind their home in Ireland during the potato famine and travel to America

episodes.title: Remarkable women: Edna O'Brien, Kate Gross and Jean Lucey Pratt – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: We explore guilt, memory and courage with a novel from Edna O’Brien, a posthumous memoir from Kate Gross and the journals of Jean Lucey Pratt

episodes.title: Children's books podcast: Eoin Colfer and Oliver Jeffers on their picture book, Imaginary Fred
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: Eoin Colfer, author of the bestselling Artemis Fowl novels, and award-winning picture book creator Oliver Jeffers have paired up to create a book about imaginary friends, Imaginary Fred. Find out how they met by chance, collaborated across continents by skype, and, of course, whether they have their own imaginary friendsBuy Imaginary Fred at the Guardian bookshop

episodes.title: Chanterelles by Evie Wyld – Forest fables podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: In our fourth exclusive sound story celebrating Britain’s forests, the Granta young British novelist Evie Wyld reads her unsettling tale of marital tension at the end of times

episodes.title: The Princess Forest by Alec Finlay - Forest fables podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: In the third of our series of exclusive sound stories celebrating Britain’s forests, the Scottish poet and artist Alec Finlay reads his tale of a mythical submerged woodland

episodes.title: The Common Dean by Alan Garner - Forest Fables podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: In the second of our series of exclusive sound stories celebrating Britain’s forests, Alan Garner reads his own tale of a newcomer who finds ‘ancient noise’ beneath the choked underlife of of Cheshire’s woodlands• Listen to The Green Stuff by Ali Smith

episodes.title: The Green Stuff by Ali Smith - Forest Fables podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: In the first of a series of exclusive sound stories inspired by the UK’s woodlands, the award-winning writer weaves a spellbinding tale from an encounter between a boy and a strange green child

episodes.title: Ghost stories with Audrey Niffenegger, Kim Newman and Jeremy Dyson – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: We explore the timeless appeal of spectres and spooks with three writers who have a particular affection for eerie tales

episodes.title: A sense of place, with Orhan Pamuk, Alexandra Harris and Mahesh Rao - books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: From the streets of Istanbul we take a tour of 13 states of India and venture out into the English weather

episodes.title: Marlon James on his Booker-winning novel A Brief History of Seven Killings – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: The winner of the 2015 Man Booker prize, Marlon James, talks about returning to 1970s Jamaica and reads from A Brief History of Seven Killings

episodes.title: Aleksandar Hemon and Saša Stanišić – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: When Yugoslavia exploded into war at the end of the last century, Aleksandar Hemon and Saša Stanišić found themselves cast adrift. We catch up with fiction from Bosnian refugees who have found literary success in the US and Germany

episodes.title: Margaret Atwood on The Heart Goes Last – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: The Booker-winning novelist Margaret Atwood joined Naomi Alderman at a Guardian Live event, where she discussed her latest vision of a bleak future, The Heart Goes Last

episodes.title: Gaia Vince, Oliver Morton and the verdict on Morrissey – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: We find out what Morrissey’s novel tells us about this charming man, catch up with Royal Society prizewinner Gaia Vince and hear Oliver Morton’s plans for reshaping the planet
tags: Royal Society prizes for science books

episodes.title: Max Porter and Katharine Norbury on grief – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: We discuss how literature can be forged from sadness with two writers longlisted for the Guardian first book award

episodes.title: Pat Barker on Noonday – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: The Booker prizewinning novelist Pat Barker joins us to discuss the third in her Life Class trilogy, Noonday

episodes.title: Elena Ferrante's Naples quartet – books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: As the mysterious Italian author Elena Ferrante publishes the final instalment of her Naples quartet in English, we go in search of a literary phenomenon

episodes.title: New fiction with Hanya Yanagihara and Andrew Miller - books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: The novelists explain how two very different books were powered by surprisingly similar ambitions

episodes.title: Surprising stories with Steve Toltz and Kate Clanchy - books podcast
episodes.author: theguardian.com
episodes.summary: The Australian novelist on transforming his own woes into comedy and Kate Clanchy on defying commercial pressure to produce a ‘literary hand grenade’
